title: Minimum Number of K Consecutive Bit Flips
content:
In an array  containing only 0s and 1s, a -bit flip consists of choosing a (contiguous) subarray of length  and simultaneously changing every 0 in the subarray to 1, and every 1 in the subarray to 0.
Return the minimum number of -bit flips required so that there is no 0 in the array.  If it is not possible, return .
